ML_AA_NAMES.AA_NAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, OSP Programme Management Office (PGMO)

ORGANISATION.OFFICIALNAME: Ministry of Defence, Land Equipment, OSP Programme Management Office (PGMO)

CA_CE_CONCESSIONAIRE_PROFILE.ADDRESS: Land Concept and Assessment, MOD Abbey Wood,, Spruce 3c, #1309

TITLE_CONTRACT.P: Project MITER Fleet Management of Construction Machinery and Mechanical Handling Equipment

TOTAL_QUANTITY_OR_SCOPE.P: The purpose of this Prior Information Notice (PIN) is to inform candidate suppliers that DE&S Land Concept and Assessment (LCA) Project Team will be holding an Industry Engagement Day in respect of the Authority’s requirement for fleet management of earth-moving, engineer construction and materiel handling capabilities required to undertake tasks in the United Kingdom (UK), on deployed operations and overseas.
The Industry Engagement event will be held at Gibraltar Barracks, Minley on Thursday 22.3.2018.
A presentation will be given from 10:00 to 12:30 followed by refreshments and a series of one-to-one sessions with individual candidate suppliers hosted between 13:00 and 17:00.

The presentation will focus on programme initiatives (under development) that use Whole Force Approach and provide further context which may shape how the MITER Service Provision could be delivered to Defence.
Engagement will also identify any remaining information requirements that may assist in the tendering process.

The one-to one sessions will provide an opportunity to present questions to the Defence Panel consisting of (but not limited to) representatives from Army HQ (Lead Customer), Army Commercial, DE & S Projects and DE & S Commercial.
Please be aware that these questions will be collated, anonymised and distributed with answers to all candidate suppliers in order to maintain transparency and equality of information.

Suppliers with an interest in Project MITER at a prime or subcontractor level are encouraged to attend. However, it should be noted that MOD will be seeking tenders and a subsequent single contract for the total service provision and will not be dividing MITER into tender lots or separate contracts.
It is hoped that this event will provide the stimulus for candidate prime and subcontractors to begin engagement towards forming candidate supply chains to bid to deliver MITER.

Requests for attendance should be made via AWARD where a registration document will be available for download, as well as additional information on venue access. Completed registration forms should be submitted via AWARD no later than Monday 19.3.2018 [17:00].
Any interested parties that do not have AWARD access can request an account by emailing DESLELCA-Comrcl-MITER@mod.gov.uk with the following information:
Please ensure to check junk folders when anticipating log in details.

ADDITIONAL_INFORMATION.P: A previous PIN was published for MITER on 10.8.2017 followed by an Industry Engagement Briefing held on 24.10.2017.
The requirement is currently delivered through the following three contracts:

CVehicles (EVP/7) — Comprises of engineering, construction and plant equipment to enable manoeuvre, construction, logistics, force protection engineering and life support. Provided under a Private Finance Initiative contract ending in 2021, whereby the current equipment fleet is owned by the contractor and loaned to MOD on demand.

Protected Plant (OSVP/0011) — Engineering Plant protected against a range of blast and ballistic threats. The small protected construction plant fleet is owned by MOD and supported by industry under a contract also ending in 2021.

Defence Mechanical Handling Equipment (DMHE) (SPPT/0015) — Pure Commercial off the Shelf mechanical handling equipment across Defence and as part of the logistic supply chain. It is currently almost entirely provided under the DMHE contract, ending in 2020. The equipment fleet is owned by the contractor and provided to MOD on a period lease basis.

MITER seeks to bring these 3 separate arrangements together under a single fleet management and support/service provision arrangement from 2020. The primary role of the MITER contractor will be to manage and sustain the combined construction and mechanical handling equipment fleet in the United Kingdom (UK), on deployed operations and overseas environments.

Currently, this combined activity consists of approximately 4,600 pieces of equipment at approximately 300 locations in 14 countries. The future scenario is expected to be broadly similar, although work is underway to establish the scope for rationalisation and efficiencies and the effect of the recent Strategic Defence and Security Review.

The Authority reserves the right to amend any condition related to security of information to reflect any changes in national law or government policy. If any contract documents are accompanied by instructions on safeguarding classified information (e.g. a Security Aspects Letter), the Authority reserves the right to amend the terms of these instructions to reflect any changes in national law or government policy, whether in respect of the applicable protective marking scheme, specific protective markings given, the aspects to which any protective marking applies, or otherwise. Suppliers must read through this set of instructions and follow the process to respond to this opportunity.
The information and/or documents for this opportunity are available on http://www.contracts.mod.uk

You must register on this site to respond, if you are already registered you will not need to register again, simply use your existing username and password. Please note there is a password reminder link on the homepage.
Suppliers must log in, go to your Response Manager and add the following Access Code: 78TPCJ6757.
Please ensure you follow any instruction provided to you here.

The deadline for submitting your response(s) is detailed within this contract notice, you will also have visibility of the deadline date, once you have added the Access code via DCO as the opening and closing date is visible within the opportunity.
Please ensure that you allow yourself plenty of time when responding to this opportunity prior to the closing date and time, especially if you have been asked to upload documents.

If you experience any difficulties please refer to the online Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ’s) or the User Guides or contact the MOD DCO Helpdesk by emailing support@contracts.mod.uk or Telephone 0800 282 324.
